quizzes.title: Law 1: The Field of Play
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of field dimensions, markings, and requirements

questions.text: What are the maximum dimensions for a football field?
questions.explanation: According to Law 1, the maximum length is 120m and the maximum width is 90m for international matches.

questions.text: What are the minimum dimensions for a football field?
questions.explanation: The minimum length is 90m and the minimum width is 45m according to Law 1.

questions.text: What is the radius of the center circle?
questions.explanation: The center circle has a radius of 9.15m (10 yards) from the center mark.

questions.text: How far must the corner arc radius be from the corner flag?
questions.explanation: The corner arc has a radius of 1m (1 yard) from each corner flagpost.

questions.text: What is the distance from the penalty mark to the goal line?
questions.explanation: The penalty mark is 11m (12 yards) from the midpoint of the goal line.

questions.text: What is the width of the goal?
questions.explanation: The distance between the goalposts is 7.32m (8 yards).

questions.text: What is the height of the goal?
questions.explanation: The distance from the lower edge of the crossbar to the ground is 2.44m (8 feet).

questions.text: What is the width of the penalty area from each goalpost?
questions.explanation: Two lines are drawn at right angles to the goal line, 16.5m (18 yards) from each goalpost.

questions.text: What is the width of all field markings?
questions.explanation: All lines must be of the same width, which must not be more than 12cm (5 inches).

questions.text: Are artificial surfaces allowed in football?
questions.explanation: Artificial surfaces are allowed where competition rules permit, and they must be green.

quizzes.title: Law 2: The Ball
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of ball specifications and requirements

questions.text: What is the circumference range for a match ball?
questions.explanation: The ball must have a circumference of not more than 70cm and not less than 68cm.

questions.text: What is the weight range for a match ball at the start of the match?
questions.explanation: At the start of the match, the ball must weigh not more than 450g and not less than 410g.

questions.text: What shape must the ball be?
What pressure should the ball be inflated to?
questions.explanation: The ball must be inflated to a pressure of 0.6 to 1.1 atmosphere (600-1,100 g/cmÂ²) at sea level.

questions.text: If the ball becomes defective during the match, what happens?
options: Play is stopped and restarted with a dropped ball
Play continues until the next stoppage
The ball is replaced at half-time
questions.explanation: If the ball becomes defective during play, play is stopped and restarted with a dropped ball at the position where it became defective.
